programme.title: rage In Memoriam 2025
programme.desc: rage pays tribute to the musicians and artists who passed away in 2025.

programme.title: rage Best of the Charts 2025
programme.desc: rage rounds up the best of the 2025 ARIA Singles Charts.

programme.title: rage In Memoriam 2025
programme.desc: rage pays tribute to the musicians and artists who passed away in 2025.

programme.title: Return To Paradise
programme.desc: Mack interrupts Glenn and Daisys wedding when an uninvited guest collapses, poisoned by a seemingly random wedding program. But by halting the wedding, has she finally pushed Glenn too far? (Final)

programme.title: Call The Midwife: Christmas Special (2024)
programme.desc: Shelagh helps a family battle against appalling poverty and Rosalind comes face to face with an escaped convict, whilst romance is on the cards for Nancy.

programme.title: rage Best Of The Guests 2025
programme.desc: rage revisits the best of 2025s guest programmers, from Mallrat to Evan Dando, The Offspring, Ninajirachi, Paris Texas, Ruel, DIIV and more.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going with wall-to-wall music videos, from new releases to classics and the long-forgotten.

programme.title: Annabel Crabbs Civic Duty
programme.desc: Democracies operate according to rules, but they also change. Sometimes at the hands of visionary or power-hungry leaders, sometimes in response to external forces, and sometimes as a result of people power. (Final)

programme.title: Compass
programme.desc: Theres a disturbing trend taking place in our schools and misogyny is on the rise in classrooms. Siobhan Marin investigates how we can tackle this issue without alienating boys or tipping them further into the manosphere.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Rare Plants, Youth Justice and Palms
programme.desc: Tino Carnevale meets a dietitian gardening for health; Millie Ross conserves rare plants; Josh Byrne grows edible perennials; Clarence Slockee visits a youth justice project; and Jerry Coleby-Williams profiles palms.

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes
programme.desc: Scotlands Highlands and Islands is the destination this week when Sandi Toksvig escapes with agony aunt, psychotherapist and best-selling author Philippa Perry.

programme.title: Living With Devils
programme.desc: In a wild and windswept corner of Australia, acclaimed film-maker Simon Plowright spends a year living with the iconic but endangered marsupial, the Tasmanian Devil.

programme.title: The Imitation Game
programme.desc: The Imitation Game portrays the race against time by cryptanalyst Alan Turing and his team of code-breakers at Britains top-secret Government Code and Cypher School, during the darkest days of World War II.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Darrells temper rears its head again when Miss Johnson introduces tough new school rules - can she hold it together and play her best lacrosse in front of the county scout?

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Unhappy Camper
programme.desc: When Mr McGillicks phone goes missing at the Grade Five camp, Kyle is accused of hiding it as part of a prank.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Ruth and Connie have received a camera for their birthday, but when the mischievous second formers take a comedic photo of Matron, they have to work to retrieve the film!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: An angry, rampaging giant faces the gang in Ireland.

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Days
programme.desc: Racing to circumnavigate the globe in 80 days and earn 10 million clams, Passepartout the marmoset embarks on a crazy and thrilling adventure full of twists and surprises with his friend Phileas, a reckless and greedy frog.

programme.title: Officially Amazing
programme.desc: Be officially amazed by some incredible parallel parking attempt plus shooting a bow and arrow with the feet.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Sally returns to a very different Malory Towers. They need to warn Miss Grayling of the strict new rules...but theyll have to get through Miss Johnson first.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Alicia and Darrells friendship is put to the test when Alicia adds obstacles to the school race as they battle for the title of Games Captain. Meanwhile, Ruth and Susan go in search of answers about Mr Murrays findings.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: A creepy Scarecrow Ghost haunts a farm.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Paddington 2
programme.desc: Paddington, now happily settled with the Brown family and a popular member of the local community, picks up a series of odd jobs to buy the perfect present for his Aunt Lucys 100th birthday, only for the gift to be stolen.

programme.title: Rage
programme.sub-title: rage Vault Guest Programmer: The Kills (2009)
programme.desc: Ever felt someones hangover through a television screen? Now you can. This is The Kills guest programming rage back in 2009.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: When a young popstar is found dead at a rehab clinic, it initially looks like a tragic accident. But Neville is convinced theres more to her death than meets the eye.

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: With showtime approaching, and an online audience waiting, the pressure is on. However, Richelle discovers she may be about to lose everything she has worked for...

programme.title: Miraculous World: New York, United Heroez
programme.desc: During a school field trip, Ladybug and Cat Noir meet the American superheroes, whom they have to save from an akumatised super-villain. They discover that Miraculous exist in the United States too.

programme.title: Badjelly
programme.desc: The path to Mudwiggles ferry leads the gang through the lair of The Unfungi, a grumpy old hermit who lives in a cave full of puzzles and traps.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Its a trucking fantastic episode as the mythbusters hit the road to test some Big Rig Myths. And they dont get any bigger than this.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Laura Staines and partner Gavin have been trying to sell their Whitley Bay three-bed home for more than a year. Phil makes it his mission to get them an offer but mould and mildew make for uneasy bedfellows.

programme.title: Melbourne Comedy Festival Allstars Supershow
programme.desc: Hannah Gadsby hosts a night of dazzling comedy with some of the brightest stars including Mel Buttle, Dilruk Jayasinha, David ODoherty, Urzila Carlson, Dave Hughes, Anne Edmonds, Dane Simpson and Dave Thornton. (Final)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous Christmas Special
programme.desc: Its Christmas time and Eddy has been bitten by the home-makeover bug. Meanwhile, Saffy is doing her best to get Patsy to move out and Bubble continues to sneer at anyone less posh than her.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Piper and Amy bet on themselves in an attempt to impress Drew before Richelle, and TNS dance what might be their final number as a team.

programme.title: Miraculous World: London, At The Edge Of Time
programme.desc: Marinette, now Chronobug, teams up with Bunnyx in order to defeat a mysterious opponent who travels through time...and knows about Ladybugs secret identity!

programme.title: Do Not Watch This Show
programme.desc: Mr Goblin puts a curse on Wizz for being rude. The more you watch, the more Wizz shrinks!

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: In Tilehurst, dad Dan and son Chester are failing to impress the yummy mummies with their very blokey three-bed. After six months on the market, Phil steps in to help them find their feminine side.

programme.title: The Yearly With Charlie Pickering 2025
programme.desc: Charlie wraps up 2025 with Margaret Pomeranz, Rhys Nicholson, Tom Gleeson, Abbey Gelmi and more. And if you cant recall the year, dont worry; The Yearly remembers it, so you dont have to.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Nubs and the Jedi protect his favourite tree.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: After the disappearance of Mrs Fotheringill, Mrs Elf becomes the twins new teacher.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: Toodloo shows her balancing skills and Great BigHoo, while Chickedy and Chick run and roll out of the way.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: When Daniel and his friends learn to play T-ball, they find out that Henrietta is a dance teacher and a T-ball coach

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Check this out Suds - volcanoes! How exciting! Fizzy and Suds find out about all about volcanoes and lava. Plus, we build our own volcano!

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Tsehay has made some lemonade to share with her friends! There is some for Simon, but then there is no lemonade left for Anthony. What to do? Dorothy flies off in the Big Red Plane for help.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Mrs Brown has bought an old camper van and decides to take the family on a camping holiday, but they get no further than the park and then get locked in!

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: Its the fairy and witch family spring ritual of "Hunt The Bluebell.

programme.title: Knee High Spies
programme.desc: Lauchie and Scarlett are making a homemade movie with their toys in the backyard, but Silver Paw is determined to be the superstar.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds visit an observatory to explore our planets! They see how planets orbit the Sun, what theyre made of, and theres a special trip to Mars!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach Summer Special
programme.desc: The cadets become stranded on a deserted beach and all seems lost. But Neville recalls another time they almost gave up, and we flashback to the first day of summer at Kangaroo Beach.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: The Town Hall clock has lost its Ding Dong. Myrtle relies on it to remind her to make important mayoral phone calls, Hattie to take her scones out of the oven so they dont burn, and Cynthia to start the train.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Siblings squabble about who gets to use the garden shed. Can the band settle the argument?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Granny and her friends historical re-enactment society are being cave people today. Peppa and George join in helping to catch Grandpa Pig who is dressed as a woolly mammoth.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Whilst searching for new discoveries a rockfall traps Dad, Cosima and Big Lizard in a cave. Just when all is lost Dad finally discovers a new species!

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Rosa and Pola are planning a family movie afternoon, but Tish and Bobby cant decide on what to watch.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: When CeCe visits the Dream Factory, Drew and Jonathan share the story of how they built the factory and began their dream.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Jelly Fish Bloom
programme.desc: When Shellington gets trapped in the middle of a massive Jellyfish bloom, its up to the Octonauts to rescue him!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: When King Tiger suddenly cries out that his ruby has gone, the missing jewel turns the party into a mystery to be solved. Luckily Duggee has his Mystery Badge and some enthusiastic Squirrels to investigate!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy wants to be the fastest delivery person ever! But when her brakes fall off, its up to Fireman Sam to rescue her before she gets to the cliffs!

programme.title: Knee High Spies
programme.sub-title: Mission Stop the Stink / Mission Hooray for Holidays
programme.desc: Glitch builds a stink-making machine to wreak havoc on afternoon tea with Nana. / The spies are excited to be going on a family vacation.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and the junior gardeners create magical teeny tiny gardens, perfect for small spaces.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Today is the fire station practise day. Mummy Pig joins with the other mummies to practise fighting fires. The fire brigade demonstrate their practice using their motto: Ready, Steady, Go!

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the Peas reluctantly babysit a mischievous Baby Bananaraptor that proves to be more than a handful.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Gekko tries to train a naughty monkey... and hide this from An Yu.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee is cleaning the clubhouse so the squirrels take refuge in the treehouse, but oh dear its getting a little bit cramped these days. Norrie has an idea - maybe they need to add an extension.

programme.title: Piripenguins
programme.desc: Nugget tries to make her friends Wishing Tree dreams come true but gets in a muddle.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The Jedi help a young bounty hunter find her brother.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: For an entire day the Kingdom has to make do without help from magic.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The colourful bird-like creatures use a pump to help inflate a giant dinosaur for a bunch of children, and the Robot visits the Big Red Rocket.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Max learns that Mr. McFeely is the story time reader and a mail carrier. You can be more than one thing!

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: GRRRRR... Fizzy and Suds get up close and personal with some pretty cool prehistoric creatures. They meet a model Australovenator, Spinosaurus, and a Triceratops! So come along on a dinosaur adventure!

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Its dress up as your favourite animal day in Wiggle Town, what is your favourite animal? While looking for dress ups, Tsehay and John come across a cow hat, who does it belong to?

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: The town hall is leaking and needs a new roof and Paddington must stay silent to raise the money. Will Mr Brown really shave off all his hair for charity?

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: When Granny and Grandpa Moon are babysitting Isadora and her baby sister Honeyblossom.

programme.title: Knee High Spies
programme.desc: While Pranksy tries to paint a giant picture of Silver Paw on the playroom wall, Squash wishes he had his very own human to love him.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds discover some of the clever things that happen on railways! Two passenger trains become one in a faraway railway station, and then they see how freight trains move giant boxes all around the country!

programme.title: Blueys Big Play
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo pull out all the stops to try to get Dad off his phone in their first live stage show, brought to life by brilliant puppets and featuring brand new original music.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: The band are planning a surprise party for Andys Mum but will she discover their secret?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are pretending to hold babies while Mummy and Daddy Pig look after Evie. They ask if Peppa wants to hold Evie, but Peppa decides to practice first.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: A young Broccoliosaurus isnt tall enough to reach the delicious blooming flowers high in the trees until Ginger and the Baby Pea-Rexes come up with an ingenious way to get to them.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Tish is having a quiet day at home. Rosa is working, Pola is gardening. Bobby is counting is blocks, one to twenty-hundred... Tish keeps thinking of questions to ask.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: When Carlos cant find his robot, Roboto, the Brothers decide to 3D print him a new slightly smaller one - only they end up creating pandemonium when the printer creates more robots than they can handle.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Scary Spookfish
programme.desc: The Octonauts try to pull Peso out of an oceanic trench and get some help from a strange-looking creature with a see-through head - a Spookfish.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: When Eugene unexpectedly drops out of running the Summer Fair, Duggee and the Squirrels hold an Election to decide whos the best candidate for the job.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Tom Thomas obsession with a birdwatching app causes him to tumble off a cliff, its up to a new helicopter pilot to save the day!

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Olive and Otto must stop zeroes from disappearing before the missing zeroes destroy the town...and Otto turns into a baby.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Ben is disappointed about missing out on a plane trip, Millie and Maya set out give him the most magnificent flight in the backyard.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Costa and the junior gardeners brew some smelly grass tea for their lawn and a yummy native grass drink for themselves.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and family are driving across America to get to Hollywood. They stop at a diner and meet another Miss Rabbit. She sings them some songs and cooks, and then they go to a barn dance and watch Monster Trucks.

programme.title: Play School Show Time
programme.desc: Strum and hum along with Josh Pyke on the ukulele as he visits the elephants, monkeys and koalas at the Play School Zoo in his whimsical rendition of Going To The Zoo.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Uncle Rad and Frisky accidently turn up to babysit Bluey and Bingo on the same night, they have to work together to make Bluey feel better about babysitter putdowns.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Its a VERY windy day and the squirrels want to play outside. What can they do? Duggee knows, hes flying his kite. The squirrels set about making their own kites to fly. Well done Squirrels! What brilliant flags!!

programme.title: Piripenguins
programme.desc: Pancake reluctantly accepts having a big birthday party but finds a way to handle it.

programme.desc: rage pays tribute to the musicians and artists who passed away in 2025.

programme.title: rage Best of the Charts 2025
programme.desc: rage rounds up the best of the 2025 ARIA Singles Charts.

programme.title: Annabel Crabbs Civic Duty
programme.desc: Democracies operate according to rules, but they also change. Sometimes at the hands of visionary or power-hungry leaders, sometimes in response to external forces, and sometimes as a result of people power. (Final)

programme.title: Compass
programme.desc: Theres a disturbing trend taking place in our schools and misogyny is on the rise in classrooms. Siobhan Marin investigates how we can tackle this issue without alienating boys or tipping them further into the manosphere.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Craig Smart brings you the latest news and a roundup of the days top stories from across Australia and around the globe.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Bee Cause
programme.desc: Rottnest Island is home to the worlds oldest queen bee breeding program. And bio-active honey from Western Australias unique Jarrah and other forests has been discovered by the world, sparking a liquid gold rush.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Boxing Day Tsunami: Stories Of Survival
programme.desc: Stories of loss, resilience and the enduring human spirit as survivors of the 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami reflect on their survival, healing and the untold stories of a global catastrophe that still resonates two decades later.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: Start your morning with the latest headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories and the overnight news from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: Back Roads
programme.desc: Back Roads goes in search of all creatures great and small on Kangaroo Island, off the South Australian coast. Guest presenter Paul West checks in to see how the island is faring after devastating Black Summer fires of 2020.

programme.title: Culture By Design
programme.desc: Design is a reflection of history, heritage and identity. This episode explores cultural roots that influence modern design with a wood block printer in Bangalore, fashion designer in Jakarta and furniture designer in Mumbai.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Fiona Willan presents the latest from ABC News, following todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport and weather you need across the summer holidays.

programme.title: Regional Roundup
programme.desc: Live export bans expected to drive up the cost of lamb, a sky high view of Australias breathtaking backyard that youll have to see to believe, and meet the pair of rodeo young guns having a crack at the big time in the US.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: A special presentation from Landline and ABC News on Western Queenslands flood catastrophe and the long recovery ahead.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: Reality TV thrives on conflict, but is that conflict real? We look at the tips and tricks producers use to make compelling TV, and explore the impacts it can have.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.desc: Murat Dizdar is a proud working-class man whos made it his mission to win back private school students to the public education system.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Back Roads
programme.desc: Back Roads heads to Queenslands Great Keppel Island. Once a paradise for partygoers, Heather Ewart meets the locals looking for a better way to share their pristine backyard with the rest of the world.

programme.title: Jim Maxwells Ashes Memories
programme.sub-title: 1972 - A Bob Massie Masterclass at Lords
programme.desc: Jim Maxwell and Corbin Middlemas look back at some of the moments that have defined the Ashes rivalry. Part two follows Jim to Lords in 1972 where he watched from the stands as Bob Massie put on a bowling clinic.
